title: Find Your Way Without a Map
content: Use the sun: Rises in the east, sets in the west. Shadows move clockwise in the Northern Hemisphere. At night: Find the North Star (Polaris) by following the Big Dipper’s ‘pointer stars’. Use landmarks: Rivers usually flow downhill and can lead to towns. Animal trails often lead to water.

title: Stay Hidden from Threats
content: Camouflage: Use mud, leaves, and charcoal to break up your outline. Move silently: Step toe-to-heel, avoid dry branches. Travel at night if needed. Stay off trails. Cover tracks with branches. Avoid making fires or noise near people.
